snippet: After their vessel was stopped and boarded 55 miles off Misurata, crew members were able to overpower a Libyan gunman and set sail for home, the Italian Navy said.

byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick contributed reporting from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: After their vessel was stopped and boarded 55 miles off Misurata, crew members were able to overpower a Libyan gunman and set sail for home, the Italian Navy said.

headline.main: Crew Retook Italian Fishing Boat Seized Near Libya, Navy Says
headline.print_headline: Crew Retook Italian Fishing Boat Seized Near Libya, Navy Says
